abstract: Terms of a deal have yet to be completed, but 21st Century Fox’s latest reach for Sky looks well timed.
snippet: Terms of a deal have yet to be completed, but 21st Century Fox’s latest reach for Sky looks well timed.
lead_paragraph: The Murdochs are having another shot at Sky. On Friday, 21st Century Fox offered to buy the 61 percent of Sky, the European pay-TV group, that it does not own. The proposal notionally values Sky at 18.5 billion pounds ($23 billion), though only about £11.3 billion would change hands. Circumstances look a lot more auspicious than the last time Rupert Murdoch and his family tried to consolidate the business, in 2010.

headline.main: Murdochs Take Another Shot at Sky

byline.original: By Jennifer Saba and Fiona Maharg-Bravo
